layouts._comment: common is the standard layout template.

common._comment: Reserve space for RW firmware. Only used on some boards.
common.label: RWFW

common._comment: Unused partition, reserved for software slot C.
common.label: KERN-C

common._comment: Unused partition, reserved for software slot C.
common.label: ROOT-C

common._comment: Unused partition, reserved for future changes.
common.label: reserved

common._comment: Unused partition, reserved for future changes.
common.label: reserved

common._comment: Pad out so Kernel A starts on a 4096 block boundry for
performance. This is especially important on Daisy.
Kernel for Slot A, no file system.
common.label: KERN-A

common._comment: Kernel for Slot B, no file system.
common.label: KERN-B

common._comment: Board specific files, mostly unused.
common.label: OEM

common._comment: Pad out, but not sure why.
Used for Legacy Bios, and EFI Bios, not ChromeOS hardware
common.label: EFI-SYSTEM

common._comment: Slot B rootfs. Must match Root A in side for normal
updates. Will contain copy of Root A after install, and
contain new rootfs's after runtime updates.
common.label: ROOT-B

common._comment: Slot A rootfs. Rootfs + extras must fit.
FS size + Verity (64 * FS blocks) + Boot Cache (200M).
Make sure that other layouts still has room for the
extras, should you increase FS size
Note that updates will fail if the rootfs size
shrinks. (crbug.com/192136)
Changes to the offset of this partition may require
changes in cros-signing/security_test_baselines/
ensure_secure_kernelparams.config to allow secure boot.
common.label: ROOT-A

common._comment: User data, fills all remaining space on drive.
common.label: STATE

layouts._comment: Used for installs on main device
Used for bootable USB installs (not recovery).

usb._comment: Shrunken rootfs partition to support smaller USB sticks.
installation will expand this to size from base.
Slot B rootfs, unused on USB, but pad to 2M.
installation will expand this to size from base.

recovery._comment: Stateful on recovery is dynamically resized larger.
Shrunken rootfs partition to support smaller USB sticks,
Installation will expand this to size from base.
The offset to the beginning of this partition, and the FS
size must match base exactly to allow secure boot.
Slot B rootfs, unused on USB, but pad to 2M.
installation will expand this to size from base.

layouts._comment: Larger rootfs, suitable for development with symbols, etc.
Cannot apply updates when running from USB (no slot B).

2gb-rootfs._comment: Will be shrunk to size from base on install.
Will be grown to size from base on install.

layouts._comment: Larger rootfs, suitable for development with symbols, etc.
CAN apply updates when running from USB.

2gb-rootfs-updatable._comment: The partition size matches base, so it's installable.
The partition size matches base, so it's installable.

layouts._comment: Very large rootfs, suitable for development with symbols,
etc. Cannot apply updates when running from USB (no slot B)

4gb-rootfs._comment: This partition is larger than the base partition, so the
installer will corrupt the disk during installation.
